etymology.description: Depicts a fish with a stylized body and fins
etymology.interpretation: The character 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") originated as a pictogram representing a fish's form, including the body and fins, capturing its aquatic nature through its visual depiction.
etymology.simplification: 魚(魚) was simplified to 鱼(魚) by changing 灬(灬) (huǒ, "fire") to 一(一) (yī, "one"), streamlining the component structure.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃鱼(我喜歡吃魚)。
河里有很多鱼(河裡有很多魚)。
examples.pinyin: Hé lǐ yǒu hěn duō yú.
examples.english: There are many fish in the river.

examples.chinese: 今天我去市场买鱼(今天我去市場買魚)，晚上做鱼汤吃(晚上做魚湯吃)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān wǒ qù shìchǎng mǎi yú, wǎnshàng zuò yútāng chī.
examples.english: Today I went to the market to buy fish, and in the evening I will cook fish soup.
